dict.string: SoothingAudio
SoothingImages
Pick up the phone and see what your friends, near and far, are up to.
Find a funny video to laugh at on YouTube.
Cleaning and straightening up your surroundings can help you feel good.
Cook your favorite meal. Care for yourself by preparing food you love, then enjoy eating it.
Counting to 10 not enough to cool you down? Try higher…say, 100?
Work on that project you’ve been saving for a rainy day.
Get a jigsaw puzzle and have fun putting the pieces together.
Feel better about yourself by doing something nice for someone else.
Play Sudoku or do a crossword to engage your mind.
Just pick up a pen, put it down on the paper, and start doodling. See what you create
Draw or paint, without needing it to be ‘good’ — just be creative!
There's no better time to catch up with a friend via e-mail.
Catch some fish in the local pond or creek.
Go for a bike ride. Let the exercise, fresh air, sights and sounds distract your from your thoughts, and enjoy the moment.
Go for a run to raise your heart rate, clear your mind, and release some tension in your muscles.
Go for a walk. Moving your legs, even just walking around the block, can help give you a different perspective.
Go shopping. Just enjoy window shopping, or take care of overdue errands.
Go somewhere - like a friend's house - to change scenes and hang out.
Be inspired by the works of others at a museum.
Ask someone to tell you a funny story. Get lost in hearing the adventures of others.
Get on Facebook and connect with your friends virtually. What are other people up to these days?
Try molding clay. Allow your hands to create a masterpiece or to just get out your energy.
Use your mind to organize your books or spice rack. It can be nice to have some order when your emotions feel chaotic.
There’s nothing like having a trip to look forward to in the future. Why not start planning for it now?
Play a video game. Lose yourself in another world.
Play some pool, sink some balls, and have fun!
Play solitaire. Count your cards, shuffle and play, or pick up a game on your phone or computer.
Play games or learn something new with other apps.
Play with children. Spend time with the little ones in your family that crack you up.

dict.key: Put your troubles in a box

dict.string: Imagine boxing your troubles up and shelving them — you can come back to them later.

dict.key: Read a funny book or comic

dict.string: Let yourself laugh and go into another world with a funny book or comic.
Read a magazine. Thumb through articles, cut out recipes for new ideas, or get lost in an exposé.
Rubik’s Cube: it looks simple, yet it’s mystifying. Get busy with your hands and mind.
Put together a scrapbook of memories from a happy time.
Turn on your radio and sing in the car. Or blast your music at home and belt it out.
Surf the internet.
Allow your mind to take a vacation from your problems. Think about something fun or relaxing.
Take a break and let yourself sleep and recharge.
Think about the future. Imagine things you’re looking forward to: finishing school, falling in love, or going on your next adventure.
Volunteer and make a difference in someone else’s life to take your mind off yourself.
Walk your dog... he may need a break, too.
Watch a funny movie. It's hard to stay upset when you’re laughing out loud.
Turn on your favorite athletic event, from football to dance, and let yourself get into it.
Watch some of your favorite TV shows.
Scramble all the letters in your full name and see how many words you can make out of them!

dict.key: Work on a project with your hands

dict.string: Get into a project, whether it’s gardening, woodworking, or sewing.
Write poetry. Express yourself with your words and put it down on paper.
Express gratitude: write to others to let them know you appreciate them thinking of you.
